questions.question: Which set of ordered pairs represents a function?
questions.explanation: A function requires each input (x-value) to have exactly one output (y-value). Only option A has unique x-values.

questions.question: What is the domain of the relation: {(-2,4), (0,3), (1,5), (3,4)}?
questions.explanation: The domain is the set of all x-values: {-2, 0, 1, 3}.

questions.question: Which type of graph passes the vertical line test?
questions.explanation: A non-vertical line (like a diagonal) passes the vertical line test because any vertical line will intersect it at most once.

questions.question: Which represents a relation but NOT a function?
options: {x | x is a real number} to {y | y = 2x + 1}
questions.explanation: A function requires each input (x-value) to have exactly one output (y-value). Set A has input 2 paired with two different outputs (3 and 5).

questions.question: What is the range of {(0,1), (2,3), (4,5), (6,7)}?
questions.explanation: The range is the set of all y-values: {1, 3, 5, 7}.

questions.question: Is this a function: y = ±√x?
questions.explanation: No, because for each x (except 0), there are two y-values (positive and negative square roots).

questions.question: Which verbal description represents a function?
options: A person's height as their age
A student's name as their ID number
A person's first name as their last name
A person's age as their birth year
questions.explanation: For each age, a person has exactly one height (at that moment).

questions.question: What is f(-1) if f(x) = x² + 2?
Which is function notation?
questions.explanation: f(x) is standard function notation, read as 'f of x'.
